Instruments

Shop

Our local instrument shop is Windstruments at Crossflatts.

Windstruments started in 1994 as a woodwind and brass instrument repair company. Since then we have expanded into one of the largest stockists of musical instruments in the UK adding a branch in Harrogate, known as Music House, as well as Bingley.

Re-home

Got an instrument you no longer need? Need an instrument?

We’ve found ourselves finding good homes for instruments people no longer need, and we’re happy to keep on doing so.

This service is run voluntarily by Dave Johnson at Bingley Guitar Studio, First Floor 122-124 Main Street (above Ison Harrison Solicitors), Bingley, BD16 2HL

Effects Library

We’ve also go an effects library where you can borrow guitar effects pedals.

Donate an instrument

Fill in our Donate an Instrument form , and we’ll be in touch.

Request an instrument

Fill in our Request an Instrument form, and we’ll be in touch.

Amplifier

Nobels Streetman busker's battery powered 10W Amp

Would be nice if it went to a busker

Black Acoustic Guitar

Black Acoustic guitar with steel strings

This was donated in return for another guitar as a student traded up to a better instrument.

Child's Violin

Skylark child’s violin with case and bow.

In need of strings and bow ‘hairs’. Bought in 1997 but hardly ever used and been in the loft ever since.

On Loan

Ukulele

On loan until 01/02/2024

Suprano Ukulele

A good starter ukulele. It's very small. With case.

Ukulele

On loan until 01/02/2024

Beginer's Ukulele

A good beginner's ukulele. With case.

We’ve distributed the following

Classical Guitar

A classical guitar, drum sticks, and other bits and pieces that went to a gigging drummer, and the guitar went to a singer in a punk band who is also learning to play guitar.

Keyboard

A keyboard that was found in a house clearance and went to the student of a Wilsden music teacher.

Yamaha Keyboard

Another keyboard that went to a family where the child learns at school but they could not afford an instrument at home.

Clarinet

LaFleur Clarinet with a case.

Donated to Myrtle Park Primary School, where children have clarinet lessons via Bradford's Music Hub.

Guitar

Martin Smith Acoustic

One of six guitars donated by the Accessible Inclusive Music charity to pass on to anyone who is interested. Gone to an adult that already plays other instruments but is keen to explore the guitar in addition.

Guitar

Kyoto Classical

One of six guitars donated by the Accessible Inclusive Music charity to pass on to anyone who is interested. Given to a young adult who is starting to learn guitar.

Keyboard and Stand

Yamaha PSR-295

This went to a Bingley family with two primary school aged children who were looking to start playing keyboard. The donor said "I saw your post a little while ago about wanting Instruments to pass on to kids or learning musicians that may not otherwise be able to afford it. I have a Yamaha Keyboard and Stand here that is being wasted and we would love for that to go to someone and give them the start and the platform to learn and become a musician."

Acoustic Guitar

Blue Moon GR5209V

This went to a music student who was trading up to a better instrument. Good condition, hardly played, no problems as far as I'm aware. No case, but has stand, electronic tuner, capo and a couple of learn to play books & CDs. Bought from Hobgoblin Leeds 7 or 8 years ago.

Bass Guitar

Liberty Bass Guitar

This bass was donated and immediately found a home with someone who has been after a bass for sometime. With an active and a non-active pickup and unusually long 24 fret neck it's quite a thing.

Get involved

Why not become a member and get involved to make a difference?

Sign up to our mailing list to stay informed about what’s happening.

If you have an idea for music in our town, or you’re already doing something, then we’d love to hear it.
Please contact us and tell us all about it.

Can you help? See our Help Wanted page for more opportunities to get involved.
